brief_summary.textblock:
This study is designed to make sure exercise equipment used by the National Heart, Lung, and
      Blood Institute is working properly.  Healthy volunteers will be requested to use P-CCMB
      cardiopulmonary exercise equipment (treadmills and exercise bicycles) two times a month to
      ensure the machines are functioning properly.

clinical_study.brief_title: Quality Control of Cardiopulmonary Exercise Equipment

detailed_description.textblock:
Proper functioning of recently acquired P-CCMB cardiopulmonary exercise equipment will be
      verified by testing healthy volunteers.  In addition, quality control will be verified by
      performing monthly testing of healthy volunteers as biologic standards.

criteria.textblock:
INCLUSION:

        Healthy research volunteers who are between 21 and 65 years.

        EXCLUSION:

        Patients with a history of ischemic or valvular heart disease.

        Patients with history of chronic pulmonary disease.

        Pregnant women.

facility.name: National Heart, Lung and Blood Institute (NHLBI)

clinical_study.official_title: Quality Control of P-CCMB Cardiopulmonary Exercise Equipment

reference.citation: Sue DY, Wasserman K. Impact of integrative cardiopulmonary exercise testing on clinical decision making. Chest. 1991 Apr;99(4):981-92. Review. No abstract available.
Whipp BJ. The bioenergetic and gas exchange basis of exercise testing. Clin Chest Med. 1994 Jun;15(2):173-92. Review.
Wagner PD. Central and peripheral aspects of oxygen transport and adaptations with exercise. Sports Med. 1991 Mar;11(3):133-42. Review. No abstract available.
